titleStmt.title: A vindication of free-grace: in opposition to this Arminian position, (Naturall men may do such things as whereunto God hath by way of promise annexed grace and acceptation.) / First preached, after asserted at Stephens Coleman-steete [sic] London, by Mr. John Goodvvin. Also an appendix proving the souls enjoying Christ after death, afore the Resurrection, against some errours hereafter specified. Published for the justification of truth by S.L.
titleStmt.author: Lane, Samuel.

titleStmt.title: A vindication of free-grace: in opposition to this Arminian position, (Naturall men may do such things as whereunto God hath by way of promise annexed grace and acceptation.) / First preached, after asserted at Stephens Coleman-steete [sic] London, by Mr. John Goodvvin. Also an appendix proving the souls enjoying Christ after death, afore the Resurrection, against some errours hereafter specified. Published for the justification of truth by S.L.
titleStmt.author: Lane, Samuel.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Macock, for Michael Spark junior, and are to be sold at the Blue Bible in Gren Arbour.,

notesStmt.note: S.L. = Samuel Lane, whose name appears on leaf A3r.
The sentence in title "Naturall men may do such things as whereunto God hath by way of promise annexed grace and acceptation" is printed between square brackets.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
